404.title: FEFELOV — 404.
404.heading: Page Not Found
404.text: It may have been deleted or you entered the wrong address

index.title: FEFELOV — Education and IT.
index.description: FEFELOV — help with course papers, theses, essays, research papers. Development of websites, applications, Telegram bots, parsers. Data analytics. We work officially under contract. IE Basenko I.K. Moscow.

hero.text: We help with academic projects, develop software, and provide consulting on complex issues. We work officially, under contract.

education.title: Educational Services
education.text: Academic work consulting, help with coursework, theses, essays. Tutoring and exam preparation.

development.title: Software Development
development.text: Website creation, mobile apps, process automation. From simple landing pages to complex systems.

documents.title: Document Preparation
documents.text: Formatting, editing, typesetting documents. Presentations, reports, technical documentation.

research.title: Research
research.text: Scientific research in humanities and social sciences. Data analysis, statistics, analytics.

data.title: Data Processing
data.text: Collection, processing and analysis of information. Parsing, data structuring, integrations.

consulting.title: Consulting
consulting.text: Individual consultations on any issues. Communication with third parties on your behalf.

study.label: Education
study.title: FEFELOV.Study
study.text: Information, consulting and educational services. Helping students with academic projects of any complexity: from essays to theses. Tutoring in school and university subjects, preparation for exams and entrance tests.

tech.label: Technology
tech.title: FEFELOV.Tech
tech.text: IT division: full development cycle — from idea to launch. We create websites, mobile apps, Telegram bots, CRM systems. Data parsing, API integrations, business process automation. Technical support and maintenance.

about.label: About
about.title: We Work Officially
about.text1: IE Basenko Ilya Konstantinovich is an officially registered individual entrepreneur in Moscow. We work under oral or written contract, providing all necessary documents. In any case, by contacting us, a person accepts the terms of the public offer.
about.text2: We provide services in education and IT in compliance with Russian Federation legislation. Each order is recorded, all conditions are transparent.
about.text3: Our goal is quality results and long-term cooperation. We value our clients' time and our own.

cta.label: Contact
cta.title: Ready to Discuss a Project?
cta.text: Write to us — we'll discuss the task, deadlines and cost. We respond during business hours: Mon-Fri, 10:00-20:00 MSK.

contacts.title: FEFELOV — Contacts.
contacts.description: FEFELOV contacts: email, VKontakte, IE Basenko I.K. details. Working hours: Mon–Fri 10:00–20:00 MSK. Moscow.

header.label: Contact Us
header.title: Contacts
header.text: Choose a convenient way to contact us. We respond during business hours.

notice.title: Before Contacting
notice.text: By contacting us, you automatically accept the terms of the public offer, the privacy policy and the refund policy. We work under an oral or written contract — in any case, all documents are accepted upon contact.

terms.title: FEFELOV — Public Offer.
terms.description: FEFELOV public offer: terms for providing educational and IT services, payment procedure, deadlines, responsibility of the parties. IE Basenko I.K.

header.label: Legal Information
header.title: Public Offer
header.subtitle: for information, consulting, educational and IT services

important.title: Important
important.text: By contacting the Contractor in any way (messengers, social networks, phone, email), you confirm that you have read these terms and fully accept them.

s1.title: 1. Terms and Definitions
s1.p1_1_text: IE Basenko Ilya Konstantinovich (OGRNIP 325774600531587, INN 772370980295), as well as authorized representatives acting on his behalf.
s1.p1_2_text: An individual or legal entity who has applied to the Contractor for services and accepted the terms of this offer.
s1.p1_3_text: An authorized representative of the Contractor who communicates with the Customer through official channels. The Manager is authorized to agree on terms on behalf of the Contractor.
s1.p1_4_text: Information, consulting, educational, IT services and other services provided by the Contractor in accordance with the list specified in Section 2.
s1.p1_5_text: Materials, documents, files, software code, consultations and other results of services provided to the Customer.
s1.p1_6_text: The process of the Contractor's interaction with third parties (teachers, experts, organizations) in the Customer's interests. Communication does not imply immediate results.

s2.title: 2. List of Services
s2.p2_3: 2.3. The list of services is not exhaustive. The specific scope, deadlines and cost are agreed individually with each Customer and recorded in correspondence.

s3.title: 3. Offer Acceptance
s3.p31_intro: Acceptance of this offer is any of the following actions:
s3.item311_text: Sending a message to the Contractor or their representatives through any communication channels
s3.item312_text: Making a phone call to the Contractor
s3.p32: The contract is considered concluded from the moment of the Customer's first contact with the Contractor. Correspondence in messengers and social networks has legal force and is proper confirmation of agreed terms.
s3.p33: If contractual relations existed between the Customer and Contractor previously without a written contract, the terms of this offer apply to such relations from the moment of its publication. Continued interaction confirms acceptance of the terms.
s3.p34: Even if the terms of this offer were not directly mentioned during work, the fact of contacting the Contractor means full acceptance of all its terms. Ignorance of the offer terms does not exempt from their compliance.

s4.title: 4. Payment Procedure
s4.p42_intro: By agreement with the manager, payment in two stages is possible:
s4.table42_row2_c3: Before delivery of results or within 24 hours after
s4.p43_intro: The Contractor has the right to choose one of the options:
s4.item431_text: Wait for full payment (100%) and then deliver the result
s4.item432_text: Deliver the result for verification with obligation to pay the remainder within 24 hours
s4.p43_note: The choice of option remains with the Contractor or is agreed with the manager.
s4.p45: In exceptional cases, an installment plan may be provided. Terms (deadlines, payment schedule) are recorded in correspondence and are binding.
s4.p46: Payment is made by methods agreed with the manager: bank transfer, SBP, electronic payment systems.
s4.p47_intro: If services were provided without any prepayment (neither 100% nor 50%), the resulting debt must be paid in full:
s4.item472_text: If not paid — measures of Section 8 apply (0.5% penalty per day from day 8)
s4.item473_text: The Contractor has the right to collect the debt through court according to Articles 309, 310, 395 of the Civil Code
s4.item474_text: The fact of service provision is confirmed by correspondence, file transfers, system logs
s4.item475_text: The absence of a written contract does not exempt from payment obligations (paragraph 1 of Article 434, Article 438 of the Civil Code)
s4.p41: Standard payment procedure — 100% prepayment before services are provided.
s4.p44: If the result is delivered before full payment is received, the Customer must pay the remainder within 24 hours from receipt. Non-payment within the specified time is a violation and entails consequences specified in Section 8.
s4.item471_text: The Customer must pay 100% of the cost within 24 hours from receipt of the result

s5.title: 5. Working Hours
s5.p57: Saturday, Sunday and public holidays according to the Russian Federation production calendar are non-working days.
s5.p58: The Contractor has the right to refuse processing inquiries that are systematically received outside working hours with demands for immediate response.
s5.p59: At the Contractor's discretion, services may be provided outside working hours. This is a right, not an obligation. The Customer may not demand work outside the established schedule.
s5.item1: 5.3.1. Messages received after 20:00, on weekends and holidays, are processed on the next business day
s5.item2: 5.3.2. The Contractor and managers are not obliged to read and respond to messages outside working hours
s5.item3: 5.3.3. Lack of response outside working hours is not a breach of obligations

s6.title: 6. Communication
s6.p61: Communication means the Contractor's interaction with third parties in the Customer's interests: communication with teachers, experts, representatives of organizations and other parties.
s6.p63: Deadlines are determined by the Contractor and depend on the availability of third parties, complexity of the issue, workload and other objective circumstances.
s6.p64: Payment for communication services does not mean that the result will be obtained immediately or within a specific hour/day. The Customer accepts that communication is a process with an indefinite completion time, which is established by the Contractor.
s6.p62: Communication does not imply an immediate result.
s6.p65: Communication with the Customer is carried out through the channels listed on the contacts page:

s7.title: 7. Urgency
s7.p72: The specified coefficients are indicative. The final surcharge is determined individually.
s7.li73_4: Day of week and time of day
s7.li73_6: Need for communication with third parties
s7.h74_title: 7.4. Examples of Urgency Calculation by Service Type
s7.p71: An additional fee is charged for urgent service completion (shortened deadlines). Working hours — according to Section 5 (Mon–Fri, 10:00–20:00 MSK).
s7.p74: All deadlines are specified in business days (Mon–Fri, 10:00–20:00 MSK). Actual deadlines depend on the volume and complexity of the task.
s7.p75: The final surcharge is agreed before the urgent order begins and is paid in the manner established by Section 4. The Contractor may refuse urgent performance without explanation.

s8.title: 8. Late Payment and Penalties
s8.table_action2: Repeated reminder, warning about penalty charges
s8.table_action3: Penalty charge of 0.5% of debt amount per day
s8.item8_2_1: Penalties are charged at 0.5% of the debt amount per day of delay
s8.item8_2_2: Penalty charges begin from the 8th day of delay
s8.item8_2_3: Maximum penalty amount is not limited
s8.p8_3: The Contractor has the right at its discretion to:
s8.item8_3_1: Not charge penalties if the Customer has valid reasons
s8.item8_3_2: Reduce the amount of charged penalties
s8.item8_3_4: Provide additional payment deferment without charging penalties
s8.p8_3_note: The decision to apply these measures is made by the Contractor individually and communicated to the Customer. This right does not create reasonable expectations for the Customer to be exempted from penalties.
s8.p8_4: In case of filing a lawsuit, all legal costs (court fees, legal services, representative expenses) are borne by the Customer.
s8.p8_5: The Contractor has the right to transfer debt information to third parties for collection.
s8.note: Note: all time limits in this section are calculated in calendar days. Working days and hours are defined according to Section 5 (Mon–Fri, 10:00–20:00 MSK, weekends and Russian Federation holidays are non-working).

s9.title: 9. Dispute Situations
s9.item9_1_1: If no response within 3 days — repeated notification
s9.item9_1_2: If no response within 7 days — warning about penalty charges and possible lawsuit
s9.item9_1_3: If no response for more than 14 days — pre-trial claim is sent without additional notifications
s9.item9_1_4: Ignoring does not exempt from payment obligation
s9.item9_2_1: If the Customer responds but avoids resolving payment issues — this is equivalent to delay
s9.item9_2_2: The Contractor records the fact of evasion in correspondence
s9.item9_2_3: After 3 attempts to get a specific answer — proceed to standard collection procedure
s9.h9_3: 9.3. Manager Delivered Result Before Full Payment
s9.item9_3_1: Delivery of result does not exempt the Customer from payment obligation
s9.item9_3_2: The Customer must pay the remainder within 24 hours
s9.item9_3_3: If not paid on time — measures of Section 8 apply
s9.item9_3_4: Manager's error is not grounds for non-payment
s9.item9_4_1: The Customer must immediately report difficulties
s9.item9_4_2: The Contractor may provide a deferment (see Section 8.3)
s9.item9_4_3: Deferment terms are recorded in correspondence and are binding
s9.item9_4_4: Violation of deferment terms — immediate application of Section 8 measures
s9.item9_5_1: Quality complaints are accepted within 3 days after receiving the result
s9.item9_5_2: Complaint must be substantiated and contain specific remarks
s9.item9_5_3: The Contractor reviews the complaint within 5 business days
s9.item9_5_4: Unsubstantiated complaints are not grounds for non-payment
s9.item9_5_5: Customer's use of the result means acceptance
s9.item9_5_6: Number of free revisions — no more than 2 iterations for objective remarks (non-compliance with requirements)
s9.item9_5_7: Subjective edits (third party requests outside requirements) are performed at the Contractor's discretion
s9.h9_6: 9.6. Demand for Urgent Work Outside Working Hours
s9.item9_6_1: The Contractor may refuse without explanation
s9.item9_6_3: Demand for immediate response outside working hours does not create obligations for the Contractor
s9.item9_7_1: Terms agreed by manager in correspondence are binding for both parties
s9.item9_7_2: In case of contradiction with the offer — priority goes to what was agreed in correspondence
s9.item9_7_3: Verbal agreements must be confirmed in correspondence
s9.item9_5_8: Detailed terms for revisions and refunds — see the Refund Policy
s9.note: Note: complaint review time limits are calculated in business days according to Section 5 (Mon–Fri, 10:00–20:00 MSK). Overdue periods are in calendar days.

s10.title: 10. Rules of Conduct for Parties
s10.item10_1_1: Respond to Contractor's messages in a timely manner
s10.item10_1_2: Provide complete and accurate information for service delivery
s10.item10_2_1: Ignoring messages when there is a debt
s10.item10_2_2: Avoiding responses and delaying issue resolution
s10.item10_2_4: Demanding immediate response outside working hours
s10.item10_2_5: Spreading false information about the Contractor
s10.p10_3: In case of threats, pressure or blackmail:
s10.item10_3_1: All correspondence is recorded and preserved
s10.item10_3_2: The Contractor may contact law enforcement
s10.item10_3_4: Debt is subject to immediate collection
s10.item10_4_3: Requirement for 100% prepayment to continue work
s10.note: Note: “non-working time” means time outside the schedule specified in Section 5: before 10:00 and after 20:00 MSK on weekdays, as well as weekends and Russian Federation holidays.

s11.title: 11. Liability of Parties
s11.p11_1: The Contractor provides information, consulting and educational services. Results are advisory and reference in nature.
s11.item11_2_1: The Customer bears responsibility for how materials are used
s11.item11_2_2: The Contractor is not liable for consequences of using the results
s11.item11_2_3: The Customer independently evaluates the applicability of materials
s11.p11_3: The Contractor does not disclose Customer's personal data, except as required by Russian Federation law or necessary to protect the Contractor's rights.
s11.p11_4: Parties are released from liability for non-performance of obligations upon occurrence of force majeure circumstances.

s12.title: 12. Dispute Resolution
s12.item12_1_1: Before filing a lawsuit, sending a written claim is mandatory
s12.item12_1_3: Claim is sent in correspondence or by email
s12.p12_2: If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiations, it is referred to court at the Contractor's location.
s12.p12_3: This offer is governed by the legislation of the Russian Federation.

s13.title: 13. Final Provisions
s13.p13_1: The Contractor may unilaterally modify the offer terms. Modifications take effect from the moment of publication.
s13.p13_2: The offer is valid indefinitely until withdrawn by the Contractor.
s13.p13_3: Recognition of invalidity of an individual provision of the offer does not entail invalidity of other provisions.

privacy.title: FEFELOV — Privacy.
privacy.description: FEFELOV privacy policy: personal data processing, data subject rights, information protection. IE Basenko I.K.

s1.title: 1. General Provisions
s1.p1_1: This Privacy Policy defines the procedure for processing and protecting personal data of individuals who have applied for services from IE Basenko I.K. (hereinafter — the Operator).
s1.p1_2: The Policy is developed in accordance with Federal Law No. 152-FZ dated 27.07.2006 'On Personal Data'.
s1.p1_3: By contacting the Operator in any way, the user agrees to the terms of this Policy.

s2.title: 2. Personal Data
s2.p2_1: The Operator may process the following personal data:
s2.item6: Other data voluntarily provided by the user
s2.p2_2: The Operator does not collect or process special categories of personal data (race, nationality, political views, religion, health, etc.).

s3.title: 3. Processing Purposes
s3.item5: Dispute resolution and protection of the Operator's rights

s4.title: 4. Legal Basis
s4.p4_1: Personal data processing is carried out on the basis of:
s4.item3: Legitimate interests of the Operator (rights protection, debt collection)

s5.title: 5. Data Storage
s5.p5_1: Personal data is stored for the period necessary to achieve processing purposes, but not less than the statute of limitations (3 years).
s5.p5_2: Data is stored on secure servers and cloud services in compliance with security requirements.
s5.p5_3: After the storage period expires, data is destroyed or anonymized.

s6.title: 6. Transfer to Third Parties
s6.p6_1: The Operator does not transfer personal data to third parties, except in cases:
s6.item2: At the request of authorized government bodies
s6.item3: To protect the Operator's rights (including debt collection)
s6.item4: When engaging contractors to provide services
s6.p6_2: When transferring data to contractors, the Operator ensures their compliance with confidentiality requirements.

s7.title: 7. Data Subject Rights
s7.p7_1: The personal data subject has the right to:
s7.item1: Obtain information about the processing of their data
s7.item2: Request clarification, blocking or destruction of data
s7.item4: Appeal the Operator's actions to Roskomnadzor or court
s7.p7_2: To exercise rights, it is necessary to send a request through official communication channels.

s8.title: 8. Data Protection
s8.p8_1: The Operator takes necessary organizational and technical measures to protect personal data from unauthorized access, destruction, modification, blocking, copying and distribution.
s8.p8_2: Protection measures include: access restriction, use of secure communication channels, backup.

s9.title: 9. Policy Changes
s9.p9_1: The Operator has the right to make changes to this Policy without prior notice to users.
s9.p9_2: The current version of the Policy is posted on the website.
s9.p9_3: Continued use of services after Policy changes means consent to the new version.

s10.title: 10. Contacts
s10.p10_1: For questions related to personal data processing, please contact through official communication channels (email or messengers).

refund.title: FEFELOV — Refund.
refund.description: FEFELOV refund policy: refund conditions, deadlines, application procedure, revisions and corrections. IE Basenko I.K.

header.label: Legal Information
header.title: Refund Policy
header.subtitle: Refund conditions for information, consulting, educational and IT services

notice1.text: Please note: this policy is part of the public offer and applies to all types of services provided by IE Basenko I.K. (FEFELOV.Study, FEFELOV.Tech and other areas). By requesting services, you confirm your agreement with the refund terms.

notice2.text: Note on time limits: all deadlines in this document indicated in “business days” are calculated in accordance with the working hours established in Section 5 of the public offer: Mon–Fri, 10:00–20:00 MSK. Weekends (Sat, Sun) and public holidays of the Russian Federation are not counted.

s1.title: 1. General Provisions
s1.p1_1: 1.1. This policy defines the conditions and procedure for refunding funds paid for services of IE Basenko Ilya Konstantinovich (OGRNIP 325774600531587, INN 772370980295).
s1.p1_2: 1.2. The policy applies to all types of services provided by the Contractor, including:
s1.item6: Other services in accordance with the list specified in the public offer
s1.p1_3: 1.3. Refunds are made in accordance with the Law of the Russian Federation “On Consumer Rights Protection” and the Civil Code of the Russian Federation.
s1.p1_4: 1.4. Refund conditions may vary depending on the nature and specifics of the services provided, which are agreed with the Customer individually.

s2.title: 2. Refund Before Work Begins
s2.p2_1: 2.1. The Customer has the right to cancel services before they begin with a full refund of the prepayment.
s2.p2_2: 2.2. To cancel, a written notice must be sent through official communication channels (email or messengers).
s2.item1: Paid licenses, services, access required to perform the work
s2.item2: Expenses for communication with third parties if it has already begun
s2.p2_3: 2.3. The refund is made within 10 business days from receipt of the notice.
s2.p2_4: 2.4. If work has already begun (specifications agreed, execution started), the conditions of clause 2.1 do not apply.

s3.title: 3. Refund During Work
s3.p3_1: 3.1. If the Customer cancels services after work has started, the refund is made less:
s3.item1: Actually incurred expenses of the Contractor
s3.item2: Cost of the part of work already completed
s3.item3: Expenses for purchased materials, licenses, services (for IT services)
s3.item4: Costs for communication with third parties (for educational services)
s3.p3_2: 3.2. The amount withheld is determined by the Contractor based on actual expenses and is agreed with the Customer.
s3.p3_3: 3.3. If the completed part of the work is more than 50%, no refund is made, but the results are transferred to the Customer.
s3.p3_4: 3.4. For IT projects (software development, websites, applications): if cancellation occurs after approval of the technical specification or mockups, the refund is not more than 50% of the prepayment.
s3.p3_5: 3.5. For educational services: if cancellation occurs after work has started or a consultation has been provided, the refund is made proportionally to the unperformed part of the services.

s4.title: 4. Refund After Completion
s4.p4_1: 4.1. After the service result is delivered to the Customer, a refund is not provided, except in cases specified in clause 4.2.
s4.p4_2: 4.2. A refund after completion is possible if:
s4.item1: The result significantly does not meet the agreed technical specification
s4.item2: The Contractor refused to remedy defects
s4.item3: Defects cannot be remedied within a reasonable time
s4.p4_3: 4.3. Quality claims are accepted within 3 business days after receiving the result.

note.title: Specifics for different service types:
note.edu: Educational services: claims related to evaluation of the result by third parties (teachers, experts) are not unconditional grounds for a refund if the work matches the original technical specification.
note.it: IT services: no refund is provided if the software product functions according to the agreed technical specification, even if the Customer changed requirements after project delivery.
note.docs: Document preparation: refusal by a government body to accept a document for reasons not specified by the Customer in the technical specification is not grounds for a refund.
note.research: Scientific research: negative research results (refutation of the hypothesis) are not grounds for a refund.
note.data: Data processing: discrepancy between analytical conclusions and the Customer’s expectations is not grounds for a refund if the methodology was agreed.

s4.p4_4: 4.4. The claim must contain specific remarks indicating non-compliance with the technical specification.

s5.title: 5. Cases Where No Refund Is Provided
s5.item1: If the Customer used the service result fully or partially
s5.item2: If the claim is submitted later than 3 business days after receiving the result
s5.item3: If non-compliance is caused by incomplete or incorrect technical specification from the Customer
s5.item4: If the Customer did not provide information required to deliver the services
s5.item5: If changes to the technical specification were made after work began without additional payment
s5.item6: If the Customer refuses cooperation without objective reasons
s5.item7: If the result was not accepted by third parties for reasons unrelated to the quality of the Contractor’s work
s5.item8: If the Customer violated the Contractor’s recommendations for using the result

subsection.title: 5.2. Additional grounds for refund refusal by service type:

edu.item1: Negative assessment by a teacher not supported by objective remarks
edu.item2: Change in educational institution requirements after submission
edu.item3: Refusal to accept work for formal reasons (deadlines, formatting) if the Customer did not communicate requirements in advance
edu.item4: Plagiarism detected by a checking system if the Customer did not specify uniqueness requirements
edu.item5: Non-compliance with methodological guidelines not provided by the Customer before work began
edu.label: Educational services (OKVED 85.41.9):

it.item1: Problems arising due to the Customer’s hosting, domain or third-party services
it.item2: Code modification by the Customer or third parties after delivery
it.item3: Incompatibility with equipment or software not specified in the technical specification
it.item4: Changes to API or conditions of third-party services after project delivery
it.item5: Customer’s lack of required licenses, access or technical infrastructure
it.label: IT services and software development (OKVED 62.01):

data.item1: Incorrect or incomplete source data provided by the Customer
data.item2: Changes to data structure or format after work began
data.item3: Inability to access data sources for reasons beyond the Contractor’s control
data.item4: Discrepancy between analysis results and the Customer’s expectations with a correct methodology
data.label: Data processing and analytics (OKVED 63.11):

research.item1: Research results did not confirm the Customer’s hypothesis
research.item2: Change in scientific advisor or journal requirements after completion
research.item3: Article rejected by editors for reasons unrelated to text quality
research.item4: Insufficient empirical base if the Customer did not provide access to data
research.label: Scientific research (OKVED 72.20):

docs.item1: Refusal to accept a document by a government body for reasons not specified in the technical specification
docs.item2: Change in formatting requirements after delivery of the finished document
docs.item3: Providing inaccurate information by the Customer for inclusion in the document
docs.item4: Failure by the Customer to meet deadlines for submitting the document to the relevant authorities
docs.label: Document preparation (OKVED 82.19):

consult.item1: The Customer did not apply the received recommendations or applied them incorrectly
consult.item2: The consultation result does not meet the Customer’s subjective expectations
consult.item3: Change in circumstances after the consultation that affected its relevance
consult.item4: Request for a repeat consultation on a previously discussed issue
consult.label: Consulting services (general):

s6.title: 6. Refund Procedure
s6.p6_1: 6.1. To initiate a refund, you must:
s6.step1: Submit a written request through official communication channels (email or messengers)
s6.step2: Specify the reason for the refund and justification
s6.p6_2: 6.2. The request may be sent to the Contractor or an authorized representative (manager) acting on behalf of the Contractor through official accounts.
s6.p6_3: 6.3. The request review period is 5 business days.
s6.p6_4: 6.4. The refund period is 10 business days from the date of the decision to refund.
s6.p6_5: 6.5. The refund is made using the same method by which payment was made, unless otherwise agreed.

s7.title: 7. Revisions and Corrections
s7.p7_1: 7.1. This section applies to all types of services provided by the Contractor: information and consulting, educational, IT services and other services in accordance with OKVED.
s7.item1: The result does not meet the original technical specification
s7.item2: Remarks are submitted within 3 business days
s7.item3: Remarks are specific, substantiated and objective
s7.p7_2: 7.2. Instead of a refund, the Customer may request a free revision if:
s7.p7_3: 7.3. The number of free revisions is no more than 2 (two) iterations within the original technical specification. By separate agreement between the parties the number of iterations may be increased.

obj_subj.title: 7.4. Objective and Subjective Edits
obj_subj.objective: Objective edits: calculation errors, non-compliance with the technical specification, typos, technical bugs — corrected free of charge within the iteration limit.
obj_subj.subjective: Subjective edits: style changes, adding sections outside the technical specification, third-party requests — performed for an additional fee.
obj_subj.p: The Contractor independently determines the nature of edits (objective or subjective) based on comparison with the original technical specification.
obj_subj.p1: 7.4.1. Objective edits are remarks based on non-compliance of the result with the agreed technical specification, requirements of regulatory documents or factual errors in the content.
obj_subj.p2: 7.4.2. Subjective edits are remarks based on the Customer’s personal preferences, third parties (including teachers, experts, reviewers, the customer’s clients) not fixed in the original technical specification.
obj_subj.p3: 7.4.3. Free revisions apply exclusively to objective edits. Subjective edits are performed at the Contractor’s discretion and may require additional payment.

examples.title: 7.5. Examples of Revisions and Refunds by Service Type

row1.col3: Additional payment or clarification of remarks

row3.col1: Add a chapter not included in the technical specification

row4.col1: Low originality (not specified in the technical specification)

row5.col1: Does not comply with guidelines (not provided)
row5.col3: The Customer did not provide requirements

row6.col1: Work matches the technical specification but the teacher dislikes the style

row1.col1: Bug: the button does not work

row2.col1: “I want a different background color” (design approved)

row4.col1: The website does not work on the client’s hosting

row5.col1: Add a function not included in the technical specification

row6.col1: The client broke the code and asks to fix it

row2.col1: Analysis result did not confirm the hypothesis

row3.col1: The Customer wants a different chart type

row4.col1: Data turned out to be incorrect

row3.col1: A government body refused (reason not in the document)

row4.col1: The Customer provided incorrect data for the document

row5.col1: Add a section not specified in the technical specification

row2.col1: The research result refuted the hypothesis

row4.col1: The academic advisor asked to change the methodology

row1.col1: A follow-up question on the consultation topic

row2.col1: Advice did not help (the Customer did not apply it)

refuse.title: 7.6. Contractor’s Right to Refuse Revisions
refuse.p: The Contractor may refuse free revisions in the following cases:
refuse.item1: Exceeding the permissible number of revision iterations
refuse.item2: Disproportion between the scope of edits and the cost of services rendered
refuse.item3: Edits conflict with professional standards or requirements
refuse.item4: Significant changes to the original technical specification under the guise of edits
refuse.item5: Excessive number of subjective or even objective edits, if there are reasonable grounds

s7.p7_6: 7.6. Requirements of third parties (teachers, experts, reviewers, the customer’s clients) that go beyond the original technical specification are considered subjective edits and are subject to prior agreement with the Contractor.
s7.p7_7: 7.7. The Contractor, being an expert in their field, may refuse to perform edits if there are reasonable grounds, including:
s7.p7_8: 7.8. The decision to perform or refuse edits is made by the Contractor based on a professional expert assessment, taking into account the nature of the service, its cost and the amount of resources spent.
s7.p7_9: 7.9. Additional requirements beyond the technical specification are paid separately by agreement of the parties.
s7.p7_10: 7.10. The Contractor may suspend revisions until disputed issues are resolved or additional payment for subjective edits is received.

s8.title: 8. Dispute Situations
s8.p8_1: 8.1. In the event of disputes, the parties undertake to resolve them through negotiations within 10 business days.
s8.p8_2: 8.2. If agreement is not reached, the dispute is referred to court at the Contractor’s location (Moscow).
s8.p8_3: 8.3. The Contractor may, at its own initiative, make a full or partial refund to settle the dispute.
s8.p8_4: 8.4. In case of unfounded claims, dissemination of false information or threats from the Customer, the Contractor reserves the right to protect its business reputation in the manner prescribed by law.
s8.p8_5: 8.5. The parties recognize that correspondence in messengers and email has legal force and may be used as evidence.

spam.title: Spam Protection
spam.hint: Warning is sent if a user sends more messages than the threshold within the specified time.
